label: adapter-sequence trimming
definition: A data transformation in which adapter sequences at the end of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

label: file merge
definition: A data transformation in which data contained in 2 or more files are merged into a single file.

label: sequence alignment
definition: A data transformation in which one or more sequences (reads) are positioned on a reference sequence template (often a reference set of genes), according to the genetic base-pairing paradigm.

label: sequence data feature count tabulation
definition: The counting of features (typically, genes) within aligned sequence data, and organization of these counts into one or more tables.

label: trimmed sequence data
definition: The results of a data transformation of sequence data in which (e.g., low quality) read bases are removed, to achieve some specific objective.

label: adapter sequence data
definition: Nucleotide sequences of molecules that are ligated to assay samples prior to sequencing of these samples;  these sequences are provided by assay kit manufacturers and typically used to combine sequencing of multiple samples in one assay run.

label: adapter-trimmed sequence data
definition: The results of a data transformation of sequence data in which reference subsequences corresponding to ligated library adapters are removed.

label: aligned sequence data
definition: The results of a sequence alignment.

label: merged aligned sequence data
definition: The results of a data transformation of sequence data in which files containing aligned sequence data are merged together

label: sequence library feature count data
definition: The results of a sequence data feature count tabulation.

label: DNA methylation profiling data
definition: The results of a DNA methylation profiling assay

label: differential expression analysis data
definition: The results of a differential expression analysis.

label: sequence trimming
definition: A data transformation in which subsequences of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

label: demultiplexed sequence data
definition: Sequence data in which an identifier subsequence has been used to categorize each reads by source.

label: multiplexed sequence data
definition: Sequence data from a sequence library generated from at least two different sources, where each read in the sequence data includes base calls from a multiplex identifier sequence that can be used to trace the source of the read to its source.
